comments:
This is a problem reported with WTP1.5.5 200707121554

While I am still trying to gather more information from the user, this is the information I have on hand.  The user was trying to create a Web service client and one of the projects complain that "The deployment descriptor of the module 'WebServiceClientProject.war' cannot be loaded."  The information I still try to find out from the user is whether the project was created by the WTP Web service wizard or just through the new project UI.

As far as I know, the WTP Web service wizard is using generic facet API to create the project and is not very likely to cause any DD loading problem in their code.

I got more information from the user, in his scenario, he had the Web service client wizard create a Web project and an EAR project.  He has chosen "Test Client" in the Web service client wizard, so the Web service client wizard would add the Web project to the EAR.  The error was actually marked against the EAR project saying that "The deployment descriptor of the module
'WebProject.war' cannot be loaded."

I have also talked to Kathy from WTP Web service, she said that there was no change around project creation in the Web service wizard that has gone into WTP 1.5.5.

The user also notices the following exception in the consoleLog, looks like that the EAR validator cannot find something in the war:

org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.exception.NoModuleFileException: A file does not exist for module element having uri: WebServiceProject.war
        at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.impl.ModuleRefImpl.checkType(ModuleRefImpl.java:497)

        at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.model.internal.validation.EarValidator.validateMessageDestinationRefs(EarValidator.java:811)
        at org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.model.internal.validation.EarValidator.validateMessageDestinationRefs(EarValidator.java:803)

        at org.eclipse.wst.validation.internal.operations.ValidatorJob.run(ValidatorJob.java:70)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.commonarchivecore.internal.exception.ArchiveWrappedException
Stack trace of nested exception:

User mentioned that he could not re-produce this problem any more with WTP 1.5.5 200707261031.  While he is conducting a more thorough test, I will reduce the severity of this bug.
The user has gone through more testings and could not reproduce the problem any more.
